SEARCH
Package com.example.moodmasters.MVC

Class MVCController

java.lang.Object
com.example.moodmasters.MVC.MVCController
public class MVCController extends Object
Class representing the Model part of MVC and is responsible for facilitating communication between the View and the Model when the View wants to manipulate data in the Model or when an object in the backend is needed to be created or a view needs to be added to the backend

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static interface 
    MVCController.MVCEvent
    This interface can be thought of a extension of the controller and for each UI interaction a corresponding class implementing the MVCEvent interface will be created containing the code that will be executed for that UI interaction

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    MVCController()
    Empty constructor for the Controller, job is to just create the Model

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addBackendView(MVCView view)
    Adds the given View to the backend and once the Model adds the object the Model will call the View's corresponding initialize method
    void
    addBackendView(MVCView view, BackendObject.State view_dependency)
    Adds a View to the backend and also at the same time lets the Model know a dependency between the View and one of the pre-existing backend objects so the Model knows what View objects to call initialize and update on during updating data of a certain backend object
    void
    addBackendView(MVCView view, List<BackendObject.State> view_dependencies)
    Adds a View to the backend and also at the same time lets the Model know multiple dependencies between the View and one of the multiple pre-existing backend objects so the Model knows what View objects to call initialize and update on during updating data of a different backend object
    void
    createBackendObject(BackendObject.State create)
    Creates the requested object in the backend
    void
    execute(MVCController.MVCEvent event, android.content.Context context)
    Executes a event on UI interaction, takes in the MVCEvent that will contain the code to execute on the UI interaction and also the context of the app for possible bringing up of new UI elements
    void
    removeBackendView(MVCView view)
    Removes a View that already exists inside the Model, this will cause the Model not to call that View's corresponding update and initialize methods

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • MVCController

      public MVCController()
      Empty constructor for the Controller, job is to just create the Model

  • Method Details

    • createBackendObject

      public void createBackendObject(BackendObject.State create)
      Creates the requested object in the backend
      Parameters:
      create - An enum representing what object the model should create

    • addBackendView

      public void addBackendView(MVCView view)
      Adds the given View to the backend and once the Model adds the object the Model will call the View's corresponding initialize method
      Parameters:
      view - The View that will be added to the backend

    • addBackendView

      public void addBackendView(MVCView view, BackendObject.State view_dependency)
      Adds a View to the backend and also at the same time lets the Model know a dependency between the View and one of the pre-existing backend objects so the Model knows what View objects to call initialize and update on during updating data of a certain backend object
      Parameters:
      view - The View that will be added to the backend
      view_dependency - The backend object the View depends on

    • addBackendView

      public void addBackendView(MVCView view, List<BackendObject.State> view_dependencies)
      Adds a View to the backend and also at the same time lets the Model know multiple dependencies between the View and one of the multiple pre-existing backend objects so the Model knows what View objects to call initialize and update on during updating data of a different backend object
      Parameters:
      view - The View that will be added to the backend
      view_dependencies - The List of backend objects the View depends on

    • removeBackendView

      public void removeBackendView(MVCView view)
      Removes a View that already exists inside the Model, this will cause the Model not to call that View's corresponding update and initialize methods
      Parameters:
      view - The View to remove from the model

    • execute

      public void execute(MVCController.MVCEvent event, android.content.Context context)
      Executes a event on UI interaction, takes in the MVCEvent that will contain the code to execute on the UI interaction and also the context of the app for possible bringing up of new UI elements
      Parameters:
      event - MVCEvent that contains code to execute for UI interaction
      context - Context of the app
